availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ambrose Powell (Harlan County farmer and soldier)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer and soldier. Lived in Harlan County, Kentucky in 1860. Married twice, first to Esther Powell and on a second occasion to Margaret M. Smith Powell. Father of Sarah Powell, Lazarus W. Powell, Franklin P. Powell, Jasper Powell, Nancy Powell, and Hannah Powell. Served as a captain (Co. B) in the Harlan County Battalion of Kentucky State Militia from October 1862 to January 1863. Served as postmaster of Poor Fork in Harlan County, Kentucky from November 1857 to April 1859.

bibl.p: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 884; Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, accessed on ancestry.com (Washington, D.C.: National Archives) (accessed on May 4, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, p. 98; "Capt Ambrose Powell," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=36492355&ref=acom) (accessed on May 4, 2017).
